Combine hard drive space by RAID.
RAID is a data storage technology that c: RAID is a data storage technology that combines multiple hard drives to enhance data availability, capacity, and/or performance.
RAID0 evenly distributes data across two: RAID0 evenly distributes data across two or more hard drives to improve read and write speeds, it lacks redundancy, and a failure of one drive results in the loss of all data.
RAID1 duplicates identical data onto two: RAID1 duplicates identical data onto two hard drives, providing redundant backup to enhance data availability. If one drive fails, data can still be recovered from the other drive.
RAID 5 distributes data across multiple: RAID 5 distributes data across multiple hard drives and using parity for redundancy. In case of drive failure, data can be recovered from the remaining drives and parity information.
At least {num} hard drives are required.
Select the hard drive(s) you want to add: Select the hard drive(s) you want to add
The name can not be changed after this s: The name can not be changed after this step

During this process, please do not unplu: During this process, please do not unplug the hard drive or shut down ZimaCube to avoid system errors.
After inserting a new hard drive, you ca: After inserting a new hard drive, you can expand the current RAID capacity.
